options.content: [[cluster]]

panels.description: The percentage of the time during which Scylla utilized the CPU. Note that because Scylla does busy polling for some time before going idle, CPU utilization as seen by the operating system may be much higher. Your system is not yet CPU-bottlenecked until this metric is high.
panels.title: Load

panels.description: Amount of requests served as the coordinator. Imbalances here represent dispersion at the connection level, not your data model.
panels.title: Requests Served $func by [[by]] - Coordinator

panels.description: Counts the total number of successful user reads on this shard.
panels.title: Reads $func by [[by]] - Replica

panels.description: Counts the total number of successful write operations performed by this shard.
panels.title: Writes $func by [[by]] - Replica

panels.description:
Represents the ‘load’ value the balancer equalizes across instances.

It is based on the number of tablets assigned to each instance, adjusted so larger disks are expected to hold proportionally more tablets.

scylla_load_balancer_load
panels.title: Tablets load by [[by]]

panels.content: Reads and Writes - Coordinator

panels.description: Foreground writes are writes that weren't acknowledged yet to the application. For instance, if a single replica responded and two are needed due to the consistency level. This metric represents a queue size, not a rate. High values here correlate with increased write latencies.
panels.title: Foreground Writes $func by [[by]]

panels.description: Background writes are writes that are already acknowledged to the application but have additional work to be done. For instance, if a replica responded and only one is needed, this request is still listed as a background request until all replicas respond. This metric represents a queue size, not a rate. High values here correlate with increased write latencies.
panels.title: Background Writes $func by [[by]]

panels.description: Foreground reads are reads that weren't acknowledged yet to the application. For instance, if a single replica responded and two are needed due to the consistency level. This metric represents a queue size, not a rate. High values here correlate with increased read latencies.
panels.title: Foreground Reads $func by [[by]]

panels.description: Background reads are reads that are already acknowledged to the application but have additional work to be done. For instance, if a replica responded and only one is needed, this request is still listed as a background request until all replicas respond. This metric represents a queue size, not a rate. High values here correlate with increased read latencies.
panels.title: Background Reads $func by [[by]]

panels.description: Number of successfully written hints.
panels.title: Hints Written $func by [[by]]

panels.description: Number of sent hints.
panels.title: Hints sent $func by [[by]]

panels.description:
Number of unexpected errors during sending, sending will be retried later

scylla_hints_manager_send_errors
panels.title: Hints-Send Errors $func by [[by]]

panels.description:
Number of times a digest read was done on behalf of a speculative retry.

Speculative retry is a mechanism that causes the client or server to speculate that a request may fail, and send a new request.

speculative retry may reduce latency in exchange for system load, but only if there is little activity.

A lot of speculative retries increases load and can harm latency more than helping.
panels.title: Speculative Digest Reads $func by [[by]]

panels.description:
Number of times a read was done on behalf of a speculative retry.

Speculative retry is a mechanism that causes the client or server to speculate that a request may fail, and send a new request.

speculative retry may reduce latency in exchange for system load, but only if there is little activity.

A lot of speculative retries increases load and can harm latency more than helping.
panels.title: Speculative Data Reads $func by [[by]]

panels.description: Holds an incrementing counter with the requests that were shed due to overload (threshold configured via max_concurrent_requests_per_shard). The first derivative of this value shows how often we shed requests due to overload in the "CQL transport" component.
panels.title: Requests Shed $func by [[by]]

panels.description: writes rate
panels.title: Writes $func by [[by]]

panels.description: The average write latency

targets.expr: $func(wlatencya{by="instance,shard", instance=~"[[node]]|$^",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^",scheduling_group_name=~"$sg"})by ([[by]], scheduling_group_name)/(scalar(count(count(scylla_reactor_utilization) by ([[by]])) != bool count(scylla_reactor_utilization))* scalar($func(count(scylla_reactor_utilization) by (instance,shard)) !=bool  count(scylla_reactor_utilization)))

panels.title: Average write latency by [[by]]

panels.description: The 95th percentile write latency

targets.expr: $func(wlatencyp95{by="instance,shard", instance=~"[[node]]|$^",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^",scheduling_group_name=~"$sg"})by ([[by]], scheduling_group_name)/(scalar(count(count(scylla_reactor_utilization) by ([[by]])) != bool count(scylla_reactor_utilization))* scalar($func(count(scylla_reactor_utilization) by (instance,shard)) !=bool  count(scylla_reactor_utilization)))

panels.title: 95th percentile write latency by [[by]]

panels.description: 99th percentile write latency

targets.expr: $func(wlatencyp99{by="instance,shard", instance=~"[[node]]|$^",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^",scheduling_group_name=~"$sg"})by ([[by]], scheduling_group_name)/(scalar(count(count(scylla_reactor_utilization) by ([[by]])) != bool count(scylla_reactor_utilization))* scalar($func(count(scylla_reactor_utilization) by (instance,shard)) !=bool  count(scylla_reactor_utilization)))

panels.title: 99th percentile write latency by [[by]]

panels.description: Reads rate

targets.expr: $topbottom([[filter_limit]], $func(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_read_latency_summary_count{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^",scheduling_group_name=~"$sg"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]],scheduling_group_name) or on ([[by]],scheduling_group_name) $func(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_read_latency_count{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]",scheduling_group_name=~"$sg"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]],scheduling_group_name))

panels.title: Reads $func by [[by]]

panels.description: Average read latency

targets.expr: $func(rlatencya{by="instance,shard", instance=~"[[node]]|$^",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^",scheduling_group_name=~"$sg"})by ([[by]], scheduling_group_name)/(scalar(count(count(scylla_reactor_utilization) by ([[by]])) != bool count(scylla_reactor_utilization))* scalar($func(count(scylla_reactor_utilization) by (instance,shard)) !=bool  count(scylla_reactor_utilization)))

panels.title: Average read latency by [[by]]

panels.description: 95th percentile read latency

targets.expr: $func(rlatencyp95{by="instance,shard", instance=~"[[node]]|$^",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^",scheduling_group_name=~"$sg"})by ([[by]], scheduling_group_name)/(scalar(count(count(scylla_reactor_utilization) by ([[by]])) != bool count(scylla_reactor_utilization))* scalar($func(count(scylla_reactor_utilization) by (instance,shard)) !=bool  count(scylla_reactor_utilization)))

panels.title: 95th percentile read latency by [[by]]

panels.description: 99th percentile read latency

targets.expr: $func(rlatencyp99{by="instance,shard", instance=~"[[node]]|$^",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^",scheduling_group_name=~"$sg"})by ([[by]], scheduling_group_name)/(scalar(count(count(scylla_reactor_utilization) by ([[by]])) != bool count(scylla_reactor_utilization))* scalar($func(count(scylla_reactor_utilization) by (instance,shard)) !=bool  count(scylla_reactor_utilization)))

panels.title: 99th percentile read latency by [[by]]

panels.content: Timeouts and Errors - Coordinator

panels.description: Requests that Scylla tried to write but timed out. Timeouts are counted in the node that received the request (the coordinator), not at the replicas.
panels.title: Write Timeouts/Seconds $func by [[by]]

panels.description: Requests that Scylla did not even try to write because replicas that were needed to execute this write were unavailable. Unavailable writes are counted in the node that received the request (the coordinator), not at the replicas.
panels.title: Write Unavailable/Seconds $func by [[by]]

panels.description: Requests that Scylla tried to read but timed out. Timeouts are counted in the node that received the request (the coordinator), not at the replicas.
panels.title: Read Timeouts/Seconds $func by [[by]]

panels.description: Requests that Scylla did not even try to read because replicas that were needed to execute this write were unavailable. Unavailable reads are counted in the node that received the request (the coordinator), not at the replicas.
panels.title: Read Unavailable/Seconds $func by [[by]]

panels.description: The number of currently active read operations
panels.title: Active reads $func by [[by]]

panels.description: number of currently queued read operations
panels.title: Queued reads $func by [[by]]

panels.description: The current number of requests blocked due to reaching the memory quota. Non-zero value indicates that our bottleneck is memory
panels.title: Writes currently blocked on dirty $func by [[by]]

panels.description: number of currently pending allocations. A non-zero value indicates that we have a bottleneck in the disk write flow.
panels.title: Writes currently blocked on commitlog $func by [[by]]

panels.description:
Reciprocal Miss Rate is a score in the range of 1 to 100 that is used to decide the fraction of read requests to send to each replica - a replica with twice the RMR value of another replica will serve twice the number of read requests.

RMR is calculated on a table level, this is an aggregate estimation of that score.

targets.expr: $topbottom([[filter_limit]], clamp_max(1 + sum((rate(scylla_cache_reads{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval]) - rate(scylla_cache_reads_with_misses{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval]))) by ([[by]])/(sum(rate(scylla_cache_reads_with_misses{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]]) + 0.00001),100))

panels.title: Reciprocal Miss Rate (HWLB)

panels.description: Counts the total number of failed user read operations. Add the total_reads to this value to get the total amount of reads issued on this shard.
panels.title: Reads failed $func by [[by]]

panels.description: Holds the current number of requests blocked due to reaching the memory quota (15566635008B). Non-zero value indicates that our bottleneck is memory and more specifically - the memory quota allocated for the "database" component.
panels.title: Writes blocked on dirty $func by [[by]]

panels.description: Counts number of requests blocked due to memory pressure. A non-zero value indicates that the commitlog memory quota is not enough to serve the required amount of requests.
panels.title: Writes blocked on commitlog $func by [[by]]

panels.description:
Data compression percentage by using compressed algorithm

scylla_rpc_compression_compressed_bytes_sent

targets.expr: $topbottom([[filter_limit]], sum(rate(scylla_rpc_compression_compressed_bytes_sent{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]", algorithm!~"raw"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]], algorithm)/sum(rate(scylla_rpc_compression_bytes_sent{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]", algorithm!~"raw"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]], algorithm))

panels.title: Compression Ratios by Algorithm

panels.description:
Bytes sent using compressed algorithm

scylla_rpc_compression_compressed_bytes_sent
panels.title: Compressed Bytes Sent by Algorithm $func by [[by]]

panels.description: Counts the total number of failed write operations. A sum of this value plus total_writes represents a total amount of writes attempted on this shard.
panels.title: Writes failed $func by [[by]]

panels.description: Counts write operations failed due to a timeout. A positive value is a sign of storage being overloaded.
panels.title: Writes timed out $func by [[by]]

panels.description:
Number of sstables currently open for reading 

scylla_sstables_currently_open_for_reading
panels.title: Open sstables for reading $func by [[by]]

panels.description:
Number of sstables read

Number of sstables disk reads

panels.title: Rows $func by [[by]]

The number of entries currently in the querier cache.

Counts querier cache lookups (paging queries)

Counts querier cache lookups that failed to find a cached querier

panels.description: Counts sstables checked after applying the bloom filter. High value indicates that bloom filter is not very efficient.

panels.description: Counts sstables that survived the clustering key filtering. High value indicates that bloom filter is not very efficient and still have to access a lot of sstables to get data.
panels.title: SStables that survived the clustering key filtering $func by [[by]]

panels.description: Total number of bytes cached in the index page cache
panels.title: sstable index file page cache used bytes $func by [[by]]

panels.description: Index page cache requests which had to perform I/O

Number of successfully written hints.

panels.title: Cache Range Tombstones Read $func by [[by]]

panels.description: Amount of row tombstones read
panels.title: Row Tombstones reads $func by [[by]]

panels.description: Amount of cache row tombstones read
panels.title: Cache Row Tombstones reads $func by [[by]]

panels.description: The number of tombstones found in SSTables. This number is updated by an SSTable update after flush, compaction, or streaming operations.
panels.title: Tombstones found in SSTables $func by [[by]]

panels.description: The number of range tombstones found in SSTables. This number is updated by an SSTable update after flush, compaction, or streaming operations.
panels.title: Range Tombstones found in SSTables $func by [[by]]

panels.description: The number of Cell Tombstones found in SSTables. This number is updated by an SSTable update after flush, compaction, or streaming operations.
panels.title: Cell Tombstones found in SSTables $func by [[by]]

panels.description: LWT read rate.

targets.expr: $topbottom([[filter_limit]], $func(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_cas_read_latency_summary_count{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval]))  by ([[by]]) or on([[by]]) $func(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_cas_read_latency_count{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval]))  by ([[by]]))

panels.title: LWT Reads $func by [[by]]

panels.description: LWT Average Read latency.

targets.expr: $topbottom([[filter_limit]], sum(casrlatencya{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^", by="[[by]]"}) by([[by]]) or on([[by]]) $func(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_cas_read_latency_sum{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]])/($func(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_cas_read_latency_count{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]]) + 1))

panels.title: 95% latency

panels.title: LWT Read Timeouts $func by [[by]]

targets.expr: $topbottom([[filter_limit]], $func(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_cas_write_latency_summary_count{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]]) or on ([[by]]) ($func(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_cas_write_latency_count{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]])))

panels.title: LWT Writes $func by [[by]]

panels.description: LWT Average Write latency.

targets.expr: $topbottom([[filter_limit]], sum(caswlatencya{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^", by="[[by]]"}) by ([[by]]) or on([[by]]) ($func(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_cas_write_latency_sum{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]])/($func(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_cas_write_latency_count{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]]) + 1)))

panels.title: LWT Average Write latency

panels.description: LWT 95% write latency.
panels.title: 95% latency

panels.description: LWT Write Timeouts
panels.title: LWT Write Timeouts $func by [[by]]

panels.description: A single Read/Write LWT will result in multiple paxos operations
panels.title: Paxos operations $func by [[by]]

panels.description: How many paxos operations that did not yet produce a result are running
panels.title: Paxos Foreground operations $func by [[by]]

panels.description: How many paxos operations are still running after a result was already returned
panels.title: Paxos Background operations $func by [[by]]

panels.description:
An LWT INSERT, UPDATE or DELETE command that involves a condition will be rejected if the condition is not met.

While it is ok, a high value may indicate that there is a potential problem with data distribution
panels.title: LWT Condition-Not-Met $func by [[by]]

panels.description:
Number of times some INSERT, UPDATE or DELETE request with conditions had to retry because there was a concurrent conditional statement against the same key. Each retry is performed after a randomized sleep interval, so it can lead to statement timing out completely.

It can indicates contention over a hot row or key
panels.title: LWT Write Contention $func by [[by]]

panels.description:
Number of times some SELECT with SERIAL consistency had to retry because there was a concurrent conditional statement against the same key. Each retry is performed after a randomized sleep interval, so it can lead to statement timing out completely.

It can indicates contention over a hot row or key

targets.expr: $topbottom([[filter_limit]], $func(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_cas_read_contention_count{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]]) - $func(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_cas_read_contention_bucket{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^", le="1.000000"}[$__rate_interval]))  by ([[by]]))

panels.title: LWT Read Contention $func by [[by]]

panels.description: Number of partially succeeded conditional statements. These statements were not committed by the coordinator, due to some replicas responding with errors or timing out. The coordinator had to propagate the error to the client. However, the statement succeeded on a minority of replicas, so may later be propagated to the rest during repair.
panels.title: LWT Write Timeout Due to Uncertainty $func by [[by]]

panels.description: Number of times a INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE with conditions failed after being unable to contact enough replicas to match the consistency level
panels.title: LWT Write Unavailable $func by [[by]]

panels.description: Number of times a SELECT with SERIAL consistency failed after being unable to contact enough replicas to match the consistency level
panels.title: LWT Read Unavailable $func by [[by]]

panels.description:
Number of Paxos-repairs of INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE with conditions.

A repair is necessary when a previous Paxos statement was partially successful. A subsequent statement then may not proceed before completing the work of its predecessor. A repair is not guaranteed to succeed, the metric indicates the number of repair attempts made
panels.title: LWT Write Unfinished - Repair Attempts $func by [[by]]

panels.description:
Number of Paxos-repairs of SELECT statement with SERIAL consistency.

A repair is necessary when a previous Paxos statement was partially successful. A subsequent statement then may not proceed before completing the work of its predecessor. A repair is not guaranteed to succeed, the metric indicates the number of repair attempts made
panels.title: LWT Read Unfinished - Repair Attempts $func by [[by]]

panels.description:
Normally, a PREPARE Paxos-round piggy-backs the previous value along with the PREPARE response. When the coordinator is unable to obtain the previous value (or its digest) from some of the participants, or when the digests did not match, a separate repair round has to be performed.

This indicates that some Paxos queries did not run successfully to completion, e.g. because some node is overloaded, down, or there was contention around a key.
panels.title: Failed Read-Round Optimization $func by [[by]]

panels.description:
Number of pruning requests.

A successful conditional statement deletes the intermediate state from system.paxos table using PRUNE command.
panels.title: LWT Prune $func by [[by]]

panels.description:
Number of Dropped pruning requests.

A successful conditional statement deletes the intermediate state from system.paxos table using PRUNE command. If the system is busy it may not keep up with the PRUNE requests, so such requests are dropped.

High value suggests the system is overloaded and also that system.paxos table is taking up space. If a prune is dropped, system.paxos table key and value for respective LWT transaction  will stay around until next transaction against the same key or until the gc_grace_period, when it's removed by compaction.
panels.title: LWT Dropped Prune $func by [[by]]

panels.description: The rate of CDC operations.
panels.title: CDC Operations $func by [[by]]

panels.description: The rate of failed CDC operations.

targets.expr: $topbottom([[filter_limit]], $func(rate(scylla_cdc_operations_failed{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]])/($func(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_cas_read_latency_summary_count{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]]) or on ([[by]]) $func(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_cas_read_latency_count{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]]) + 1))

panels.title: Failed CDC operations $func by [[by]]

the sum of normalized compaction backlog for all tables in the system.

Backlog is normalized by dividing backlog by shard's available memory.

panels.description: The general write latency histogram

targets.expr: $topbottom([[filter_limit]], $func(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_write_latency_summary_count{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^",scheduling_group_name=~"$sg"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]]) or on([[by]]) $func(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_write_latency_count{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]",scheduling_group_name=~"$sg"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]]))

$func(wlatencyp95{by="instance,shard", instance=~"[[node]]|$^",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^",scheduling_group_name=~"$sg"})by ([[by]], scheduling_group_name)/(scalar(count(count(scylla_reactor_utilization) by ([[by]])) != bool count(scylla_reactor_utilization))* scalar($func(count(scylla_reactor_utilization) by (instance,shard)) !=bool  count(scylla_reactor_utilization)))

$func(wlatencyp99{by="instance,shard", instance=~"[[node]]|$^",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^",scheduling_group_name=~"$sg"})by ([[by]], scheduling_group_name)/(scalar(count(count(scylla_reactor_utilization) by ([[by]])) != bool count(scylla_reactor_utilization))* scalar($func(count(scylla_reactor_utilization) by (instance,shard)) !=bool  count(scylla_reactor_utilization)))

panels.description:
This is a ballpark estimation of the write-messages size (like insert and update).

It is based on the assumption that write-messages are responsible for most inwards traffic.

targets.expr: $topbottom([[filter_limit]], sum(rate(scylla_transport_cql_request_bytes{kind=~"QUERY|EXECUTE",instance=~"[[node]]|^$",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^",scheduling_group_name=~"$sg"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]])/(sum(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_write_latency_summary_count{instance=~"[[node]]|^$",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^",scheduling_group_name=~"$sg"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]]) or on([[by]]) sum(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_write_latency_count{instance=~"[[node]]|^$",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]",scheduling_group_name=~"$sg"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]])))

panels.title: Estimated write message size by [[by]]

panels.description:
This is a ballpark estimation of the read-messages size (like select).

It is based on the assumption that read-messages are responsible for most outbound traffic.

targets.expr: $topbottom([[filter_limit]], sum(rate(scylla_transport_cql_response_bytes{kind=~"QUERY|EXECUTE",instance=~"[[node]]|^$",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^",scheduling_group_name=~"$sg"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]])/(sum(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_read_latency_summary_count{instance=~"[[node]]|^$",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^",scheduling_group_name=~"$sg"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]]) or on ([[by]]) sum(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_read_latency_count{instance=~"[[node]]|^$",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^",scheduling_group_name=~"$sg"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]])))

panels.title: Estimated read message size by [[by]]
